title: Ticket #5140: ccb tests refuse to say they got the message the tests are expecting
description:
lib_ccb_startd and lib_ccb_schedd vary in what daemons the collector running ccb server does a mesg in collector log saying enabling CCB server. Then there are several CCB: registered target daemon xxxxxxx. What is missing in both tests the final message.

CCB: received 'success' from target daemon xxxxxxxx.

In the test we do not care what comes after 'target daemon'.

This is not just a case of a different message for the same good state. There is no string saying it got a happy connection or any cnnection.
remarks:
2015-Jul-08 14:54:54 by jfrey:
To force CCB to be used when client and server are on the same machine, you need to set PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME to different values. In the test suite, do something like this: 
PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME=$(FULL_HOSTNAME)
STARTD.PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME=FOO
STARTER.PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME=FOO

2015-Jul-08 14:55:52 by jfrey:
I've investigating what happens when one or both ends have PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME unset to see if there's any behavior there that needs fixing.

2015-Jul-10 09:36:55 by jfrey:
Everything with PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME in the code looks fine. This test failure was triggered by changing the default value of PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME to $(FULL_HOSTNAME). Changing the test to set different values for PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME for startd and schedd fixes it.
